U

update(World) - Method in class Boost
Because boost doesn't have an active form that physically exists in the game world, there is no need to do anything here.
update(double, double) - Method in class Camera
Takes in the current global/map wide position of the kart and resolves this into the x and y coordinates of the screen and the tile position from which to start rendering.
update(GameContainer, int) - Method in class Game
Update the game state for a frame.
update(World) - Method in class Item
This function is used for Items for which we need to know if we need to delete them from the map based on a condition specific to that item.
update(World) - Method in class Oil
Since the Oil slick just sits there on the map and doesn't have any removal condition besides being run into by a player, this just stays empty.

update(World) - Method in class Tomato
This method controls how the tomato behaves in the game world in its active form.
update(double, double, boolean) - Method in class World
Update the game state for a frame.
updateEnemies(World, Racer[], Enemy[], Player, ArrayList<Item>, double[][]) - Static method in class Enemy
This method is a gateway to the methods that do most of the heavy lifting with the implementation of all the Enemies.
updateItems(ArrayList<Item>, World) - Static method in class Item
This method is passed the items on the map from World, as well as world itself.
useHeldItem() - Method in class Player
This method is called by world upon receiving the key input for using the currently held item.
